item.title: Lee add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Lee add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "Men are from Earth, women are from Earth. Deal with it." -- George Carlin

item.title: Lee add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Do I not destroy my enemies when I make them my friends?" -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Lee add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "A learned blockhead is a greater blockhead than an ignorant one." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Lee add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Lee add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Lee add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Disobedience is the true foundation of liberty. The obedient must be slaves." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Lee add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Lee add a quote by Samuel Taylor Coleridge
item.description: "I have seen gross intolerance shown in support of tolerance. " -- Samuel Taylor Coleridge

item.title: Lee add a quote by Abigail Adams
item.description: "Learning is not attained by chance, it must be sought for with ardor and attended to with diligence." -- Abigail Adams

item.title: Lee add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe. If you try it, you will be lonely often, and sometimes frightened. But no price is too high to pay for the privilege of owning yourself." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Lee add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Allow the President to invade a neighboring nation, whenever he shall deem it necessary to repel an invasion and you allow him to do so whenever he may choose to say he deems it necessary for such purpose -- and you allow him to make war at pleasure. . . . If, today, he should choose to say he thinks it necessary to invade Canada to prevent the British from invading us, how could you stop him? You may say to him, 'I see no probability of the British invading us'; but he will say to you, 'Be silent; I see it, if you don't." -- Abraham Lincoln
